meanings.definition: Adbots: automated software programs designed to deliver targeted advertisements to users.
meanings.sent1: The adbots displayed ads on the website.
meanings.sent2: Advertisers rely on adbots to reach their target audience efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The adbots had a chat about which ads to show next.
meanings.sent4: The adbots worked tirelessly, like little advertising robots.
meanings.sent5: The adbots buzzed around, spreading ads everywhere.

meanings.definition: Adbots: (verb) to use automated software programs to deliver targeted advertisements.
meanings.sent1: Companies adbot to promote their products online.
meanings.sent2: She decided to adbot her new campaign for better reach.
meanings.sent3: The adbots quickly adboted the latest deals to the customers.
meanings.sent4: He adbots with precision, ensuring the right audience sees the ads.
meanings.sent5: They adboted the ads across various platforms successfully.

meanings.definition: Adbots: (adjective) relating to or characteristic of automated software programs used to deliver targeted advertisements.
meanings.sent1: The adbots technology is constantly evolving.
meanings.sent2: Her job involves analyzing adbots performance.
meanings.sent3: The adbots strategy proved to be effective in reaching customers.
meanings.sent4: The adbots campaign was innovative and well-received.
meanings.sent5: Their adbots approach was ahead of the competition.
